page.title: 06THE NISSAN CAR FACTORY
page.content: The Nissan Motor Companies first U.K. factory is under construction between Sunderland and Washington on the site of Usworth Airport. Production of cars is scheduled to begin in August 1986 with 24,000 cars.50% of the initial 100 management staff are local people. In phase two production will increase by 1990 to 100,000 cars per annum with 80% E.E.C. content built by 2,700 employees. Japanese management personnel have arrived with their families. Their children are attending local schools and interest has been stimulated in Japanese culture. This is reflected in the factory dedication ceremony of DARUMA. This is a traditional 15th century Japanese ceremony of persevering to overcome obstacles and achieve objectives.
